TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DesignTimeData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides helper methods that can be used by control designers to generate sample data for data-bound properties at design time. This class cannot be inherited.
Docs.related: ASP.NET Control Designers Overview
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Data.DataTable CreateDummyDataBoundDataTable ();
.method public static hidebysig class System.Data.DataTable CreateDummyDataBoundDataTable() cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateDummyDataBoundDataTable () As DataTable
public: static System::Data::DataTable ^ CreateDummyDataBoundDataTable();
static member CreateDummyDataBoundDataTable : unit -> System.Data.DataTable

Docs.summary: Creates a object that contains three columns with names indicating that the columns are connected to a data source.
Docs.returns: A new object with three columns and no data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The table is not actually bound to a data source. Each column name simply indicates that it is a data-bound column. The column data types are string, integer, and string. The calling designer component must add rows and data to the resulting table.

Docs.related: ASP.NET Control Designers Overview
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Data.DataTable CreateDummyDataTable ();
.method public static hidebysig class System.Data.DataTable CreateDummyDataTable() cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateDummyDataTable () As DataTable
public: static System::Data::DataTable ^ CreateDummyDataTable();
static member CreateDummyDataTable : unit -> System.Data.DataTable

Docs.summary: Creates a object that contains three columns with names that indicate that the columns contain sample data.
Docs.returns: A new with three columns. These columns can contain data of type string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The column data types are all string. The calling designer component can call the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignTimeData.GetDesignTimeDataSource%2A> method to add rows of data to the resulting table.

Docs.related: ASP.NET Control Designers Overview
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

Docs.summary: Creates a object with the same schema as the provided data.
Docs.related: ASP.NET Control Designers Overview
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Data.DataTable CreateSampleDataTable (System.Collections.IEnumerable referenceData);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Data.DataTable CreateSampleDataTable(class System.Collections.IEnumerable referenceData) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateSampleDataTable (referenceData As IEnumerable) As DataTable
public: static System::Data::DataTable ^ CreateSampleDataTable(System::Collections::IEnumerable ^ referenceData);
static member CreateSampleDataTable : System.Collections.IEnumerable -> System.Data.DataTable

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A data source with the desired schema to use as the format for the sample object.
Docs.summary: Creates a sample object with the same schema as the provided data.
Docs.returns: A object that contains columns with the same names and data types as the provided .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The data types that can be created are the primitive types, such as number, string, and date types. Any other types are replaced by columns of type `String`. The calling designer component can call the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignTimeData.GetDesignTimeDataSource%2A> method to add rows of data to the resulting table.

Docs.related: ASP.NET Control Designers Overview
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Data.DataTable CreateSampleDataTable (System.Collections.IEnumerable referenceData, bool useDataBoundData);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Data.DataTable CreateSampleDataTable(class System.Collections.IEnumerable referenceData, bool useDataBoundData) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateSampleDataTable (referenceData As IEnumerable, useDataBoundData As Boolean) As DataTable
public: static System::Data::DataTable ^ CreateSampleDataTable(System::Collections::IEnumerable ^ referenceData, bool useDataBoundData);
static member CreateSampleDataTable : System.Collections.IEnumerable * bool -> System.Data.DataTable

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: If , the column names indicate that they contain bound data.
Docs.summary: Creates a object with the same schema as the provided data and optionally containing column names indicating that the data is bound data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The data types that can be created are the primitive types, such as number, string, and date types. Any other types are replaced by columns of type `String`. The calling designer component can use <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignTimeData.GetDesignTimeDataSource%2A> to add rows of data to the resulting table.

Docs.related: ASP.NET Control Designers Overview
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

Docs.param: An that contains the data in which to find the member.
The name of the data member to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets the specified data member from the specified data source.
Docs.returns: An object implementing containing the specified data member from the specified data source, if it exists.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method searches the specified data source for the specified data member. If `dataMember` is `null`, the first data member in the specified data source is returned.

Docs.related: ASP.NET Control Designers Overview
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
